We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s condition may be due to malaria, which is endemic in many parts of South Africa. Additional workup, such as a thick and thin blood smears, may be necessary to confirm the diagnosis. However, since the patient’s symptoms improved with acetaminophen and there are no other significant findings on exam, reassurance may be the most appropriate first step. Iron supplementation may be indicated if it is determined that the patient has iron-deficiency anemia, but further workup would need to be done to confirm this. Folic acid therapy would not address the underlying cause of the patient’s symptoms. Oral succimer is used to treat lead poisoning, which is not a likely cause of the patient’s symptoms.
